stream_context.summary: Kaze finishes functional work on Course 14 (Hand-Made Heights) and begins blue-sky planning for Course 15, now tentatively titled “Astral Arcade.”  Much of the stream is spent naming stars, fixing a looping star-grant bug, importing Badub’s ‘Funky Space Casino’ music, and brainstorming mechanics for the new low-gravity, space-casino level.

development_findings.summary: Course 14 is content-complete except for one Peach animation that Yuki will supply; all six star names are chosen.
development_findings.quote: "Honestly kind of done… all that's missing is one asset, which I'm still waiting for from Yuki."

development_findings.summary: A bug causing Peach to hand out a star in a permanent loop was traced to never setting listHead and fixed on-stream.
development_findings.quote: "Wait I never set listHead? — no wonder it didn't work, that explains everything."

development_findings.summary: The ROM now compiles to ~58 MB, leaving comfortable head-room within the self-imposed 64 MB cartridge limit after removing four placeholder songs.
development_findings.quote: "58 megabytes… we have so much space left and all the stream songs are in now."

development_findings.summary: Kaze deliberately targets the 64 MB limit for authenticity, but uses the 8 MB Expansion Pak during development to avoid time-consuming memory optimisation.
development_findings.quote: "I want to stick to the 64 megabyte limit… but I’m not even gonna try to stay in 4 MB of RAM— it just reduces development time a lot."

development_findings.summary: All game code is now in C rather than assembly, thanks to decompilation, making it easier to read and iterate.
development_findings.quote: "This is significant. It means we have the entire game in C code instead of assembly."

development_findings.summary: Imported Badub’s ‘Funky Space Casino’ track as a pre-rendered song; Kaze and Holly collaborate on exact loop points to minimise ROM size.
Fast64 recently introduced an inaccuracy that mis-reports level geometry; Kaze filed a bug report live.
Course 15 concept: central rocket/casino built over Rainbow Road, surrounded by low-gravity slides, asteroids, satellites and pinball-style bumpers.
development_findings.quote: "In my mind… a big rocket in the middle and outside there’s slides and low-gravity sections and rainbows flying around and asteroids."

development_findings.summary: Proposed mini-games accessed via arcade cabinets: (1) Whack-a-Mole, (2) Asteroids-style shooter that explodes a 3-D moon in the main map, (3) rhythm section using shock-wave hazards.  Completion yields Yoshi Coins or stars and can alter the overworld layout.
development_findings.quote: "Minigame that affects part of the level layout… you destroy it and it explodes the real moon."

development_findings.summary: Mechanic ideas: green upward-scrolling lines indicate low-gravity zones; black-hole portals transport Mario to distant sub-areas, allowing larger-feeling geography.

context_findings.summary: Kaze would only give up modding to work at Nintendo for >$110-120k salary and the freedom to create personal games.
context_findings.quote: "For working at Nintendo to be worth it… I would have to be like 110,000 or 120,000 or so."

context_findings.summary: He dislikes Nintendo’s legal aggression toward streamers, arguing that it hurts the wider industry.
context_findings.quote: "I think Nintendo is in their right… but I don't like that it's in their legal right."

context_findings.summary: Kaze thinks in ‘logical blocks’ rather than language and feels his spoken eloquence declined after years of limited social interaction.
Personal routine: maintains a structured workout schedule and is close to activating Twitter monetisation.

biobak.summary: Joined chat to discuss Course 15 layout; Kaze values his feedback on level planning.

badub.summary: Composed and delivered the ‘Funky Space Casino’ track for Course 15, plus other tracks already integrated.
Usually provides exact loop points for his music; Kaze noted their absence this time but expects Badub can supply them quickly.

zeina.summary: Greeted in chat but made no project-specific contributions during this stream.

key_stories.title: Infinite-Loop Star Bug
key_stories.summary: A newly scripted NPC was handing out a star repeatedly, creating a game-breaking loop.  On-stream debugging revealed that listHead was never initialised.
key_stories.challenge: Star granted in an endless loop when talking to Peach.
key_stories.process: Inspected conditions, printed debug values, realised listHead pointer was never set.
key_stories.outcome: Bug fixed immediately; showcased iterative live debugging.
key_stories.key_quote: Wait I never set listHead? No wonder it didn't work; that explains everything.

key_stories.title: Sizing the ROM
key_stories.summary: Adding several pre-rendered tracks risked exceeding the 64 MB ROM cap.  Kaze removed four unused songs and re-timed loops, bringing the build to 58 MB.
key_stories.challenge: Stay under self-imposed 64 MB limit while importing high-quality music.
key_stories.process: Calculated song sizes, removed placeholders, corrected loop-length math error (treated minutes as 100 s), rebuilt.
key_stories.outcome: Comfortable head-room confirmed; music fully integrated.
key_stories.key_quote: Our actual game is like 30 megabytes, not even.
